name: View Compliance Record Detail - Client Admin
description: Client Admin can view comprehensive compliance details including auto-populated fields, requirements status, and attachments for drivers/contractors in a read-only format

background.text: I am logged in as a Client Admin
I am on the Compliance Dashboard list view
there are compliance records available for viewing

scenarios.name: Successfully navigate to Compliance Record Detail page

steps.text: I can see a compliance record in the list view
I click the View button for a compliance record
I should be navigated to the Compliance Record Detail page
the page header should display "Compliance Record Detail"
the page should be displayed in read-only mode
I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
I should see the contractor name displayed as "First Name Last Name"
I should see the Company Name field populated
I should see the Contractor ID field populated
I should see the Email ID field populated
all displayed fields should be non-editable

scenarios.name: View overall compliance status with correct color coding

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page for a compliant contractor
I should see the overall status displayed as "Compliant"
the status badge should be displayed in green color

scenarios.name: View non-compliant status when requirements are not met

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page for a non-compliant contractor
I should see the overall status displayed as "Non-Compliant"
the status badge should be displayed in red color

scenarios.name: View requirements section with proper column headers

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
I view the Requirements section
I should see "Requirement" as the left-aligned column header
I should see "Status" as the right-aligned column header
the Requirements section should be non-editable

scenarios.name: View individual requirement statuses with color-coded badges

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
I view the Requirements section
I should see each requirement listed with its corresponding status
compliant requirements should display green badges
non-compliant requirements should display red badges

scenarios.name: Successfully navigate back to Compliance Dashboard

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
I click the Back navigation button
I should be returned to the Compliance Dashboard list view
I should see the list of compliance records

scenarios.name: View COI attachments in Attachments tab

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
I navigate to the Attachments tab
I should see COI attachments displayed
the attachments should be viewable but not editable
I am viewing a compliance record with missing contractor information
I access the Compliance Record Detail page
empty fields should be handled appropriately
the page should still load without errors
available information should be displayed correctly

scenarios.name: Handle compliance record with no requirements data

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record with no requirements data
I access the Requirements section
the section should display an appropriate message
the page should not show error messages
the overall status should reflect the absence of requirements

scenarios.name: Verify read-only mode prevents any editing attempts

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
I attempt to edit any field in the contractor information
no editing capabilities should be available
I should not be able to modify any requirement status
all displayed information should remain read-only

scenarios.name: Handle invalid compliance record ID access

steps.text: I attempt to access a non-existent compliance record
I navigate to the Compliance Record Detail page
I should see an appropriate error message
I should be able to navigate back to the Compliance Dashboard

scenarios.name: View compliance record with maximum number of requirements

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record with all possible requirements
I access the Requirements section
all requirements should be displayed properly
the page should handle the full list without performance issues
scrolling should work smoothly if needed

scenarios.name: View compliance record with mixed requirement statuses

steps.text: I am viewing a compliance record with both compliant and non-compliant requirements
I check the overall status
the overall status should show "Non-Compliant" with red badge
individual requirement statuses should be accurately displayed
the status calculation logic should be applied correctly

scenarios.name: Alternative access through direct URL navigation

steps.text: I have a direct URL to a specific compliance record detail page
I navigate directly to that URL
I should see the Compliance Record Detail page
all compliance information should be displayed correctly
the Back navigation should still work properly

gherkin_content:
Feature: View Compliance Record Detail - Client Admin
  Client Admin can view comprehensive compliance details including auto-populated fields, requirements status, and attachments for drivers/contractors in a read-only format

  Background:
    Given I am logged in as a Client Admin
    And I am on the Compliance Dashboard list view
    And there are compliance records available for viewing

  @smoke @positive @navigation
  Scenario: Successfully navigate to Compliance Record Detail page
    Given I can see a compliance record in the list view
    When I click the View button for a compliance record
    Then I should be navigated to the Compliance Record Detail page
    And the page header should display "Compliance Record Detail"
    And the page should be displayed in read-only mode

  @positive @data-display
  Scenario: View auto-populated contractor details correctly
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
    Then I should see the contractor name displayed as "First Name Last Name"
    And I should see the Company Name field populated
    And I should see the Contractor ID field populated
    And I should see the Email ID field populated
    And all displayed fields should be non-editable

  @positive @status-display
  Scenario: View overall compliance status with correct color coding
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page for a compliant contractor
    Then I should see the overall status displayed as "Compliant"
    And the status badge should be displayed in green color

  @positive @status-display
  Scenario: View non-compliant status when requirements are not met
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page for a non-compliant contractor
    Then I should see the overall status displayed as "Non-Compliant"
    And the status badge should be displayed in red color

  @positive @requirements-display
  Scenario: View requirements section with proper column headers
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
    When I view the Requirements section
    Then I should see "Requirement" as the left-aligned column header
    And I should see "Status" as the right-aligned column header
    And the Requirements section should be non-editable

  @positive @requirements-status
  Scenario: View individual requirement statuses with color-coded badges
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
    When I view the Requirements section
    Then I should see each requirement listed with its corresponding status
    And compliant requirements should display green badges
    And non-compliant requirements should display red badges

  @positive @navigation
  Scenario: Successfully navigate back to Compliance Dashboard
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
    When I click the Back navigation button
    Then I should be returned to the Compliance Dashboard list view
    And I should see the list of compliance records

  @positive @attachments
  Scenario: View COI attachments in Attachments tab
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
    When I navigate to the Attachments tab
    Then I should see COI attachments displayed
    And the attachments should be viewable but not editable

  @negative @error-handling
  Scenario: Handle missing contractor data gracefully
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with missing contractor information
    When I access the Compliance Record Detail page
    Then empty fields should be handled appropriately
    And the page should still load without errors
    And available information should be displayed correctly

  @negative @error-handling
  Scenario: Handle compliance record with no requirements data
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with no requirements data
    When I access the Requirements section
    Then the section should display an appropriate message
    And the page should not show error messages
    And the overall status should reflect the absence of requirements

  @negative @security
  Scenario: Verify read-only mode prevents any editing attempts
    Given I am on the Compliance Record Detail page
    When I attempt to edit any field in the contractor information
    Then no editing capabilities should be available
    And I should not be able to modify any requirement status
    And all displayed information should remain read-only

  @negative @error-handling
  Scenario: Handle invalid compliance record ID access
    Given I attempt to access a non-existent compliance record
    When I navigate to the Compliance Record Detail page
    Then I should see an appropriate error message
    And I should be able to navigate back to the Compliance Dashboard

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: View compliance record with maximum number of requirements
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with all possible requirements
    When I access the Requirements section
    Then all requirements should be displayed properly
    And the page should handle the full list without performance issues
    And scrolling should work smoothly if needed

  @edge-case @status-calculation
  Scenario: View compliance record with mixed requirement statuses
    Given I am viewing a compliance record with both compliant and non-compliant requirements
    When I check the overall status
    Then the overall status should show "Non-Compliant" with red badge
    And individual requirement statuses should be accurately displayed
    And the status calculation logic should be applied correctly

  @alternative-flow @navigation
  Scenario: Alternative access through direct URL navigation
    Given I have a direct URL to a specific compliance record detail page
    When I navigate directly to that URL
    Then I should see the Compliance Record Detail page
    And all compliance information should be displayed correctly
    And the Back navigation should still work properly
